title: Trees
credit_line: Gift of Ruth E. Wilner in memory of Jane and Milton Jena
provenance_text:
Charles E. Burchfield [1893-1967]. Possibly Frank. K. M. Rehn Gallery, New York, NY, c. 1935 [1]. Dr. [1891-1984] and Mrs. [c.1896-1971] Milton Jena, Pittsburgh, PA, by March 1938 until October 10, 1971 [2]; Dr. Milton Jena, Pittsburgh, PA, October 10, 1971 until April 29, 1984; Jena estate, 1984 until 1988; likely by descent, Ruth E. Wilner (Mrs. J. Alfred Wilner)  [1909-2010], New York, NY, 1988 until March 1995 [3]; her gift to Carnegie Museum of Art, Pittsburgh, PA, March 1995.

Notes:
[1]. See curatorial file for reference to a letter signed by Frank K. M. Rehn and dated December 17, 1935, confirming the date of the work as 1920.
[2]. Dr. and Mrs Milton Jena lent the watercolor, as "Three Trees and a Pool," to Carnegie Institute's "An Exhibition of Water Colors and Oils by Charles Burchfield," held in March-April 1938 (no. 18.) Mrs. Jeanette (Jane) Jena was an art critic for the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette for many years.
[3]. Ruth E. Wilner was Mrs. Jane Jena's sister. Mrs. Wilner had resided in Pittsburgh, PA before moving to New York, NY.

creator.death_place: West Seneca (Erie county, New York state, United States)
